result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew John Morris

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Matthew John Morris not in court.  Prosecuting attorney Mary M. Kerrigan-Mares in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Kevin L Steuck in court for State of Wisconsin. Court reschedules.Present bond continued
Plea hearing scheduled for February 14, 2023 at 10:30 am.
Final pre-trial on October 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Prosecuting attorney Kevin L Steuck in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Matthew John Morris in court, via zoom from medical center.
Not guilty plea entered by court.
Present bond continued.
Final pre-trial scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Dept of Veterans affairs sent a letter indicating that the defendant is in Milwaukee and will be discharged August 24, 2022

Defendant to have no contact with N.J.M., A.J.C. or their residence or place of employment.
Absolute sobriety. 
Take all prescribed medications as prescribed.

Defendant Matthew John Morris appeared by video, in custody. 
Attorney N. Mulvey appeared, via zoom, on behalf of the state.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 09:00 am.
